messages.message: Matt mentioned here that the billing tests are failing for an actual reason https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C052YKRTJP5/p1705010569898549?thread_ts=1705008360.874349&cid=C052YKRTJP5

• i can help set up loginless converse to work in the crafting env!
• @Aayush are you able to copy the Doc Translation app into the crafting env? it seems that `apps/src/aihub/__e2e__/ViewApp/billing.spec.ts` depends on the Doc Translation app
• @Weiming Wu can you set up the missing licenses and projects on the crafting env for the drives and view-my-hup tests to pass?
@CJ are there other things that we still need to set up on the crafting env for Cypress tests to pass?

My opinion is that we should do our best to get Cypress tests 100% passing before making the CI check blocking.

What are the reasons for these other test failures? If the effort to make them pass is really too much, we can consider moving forward by applying the `SKIP_CI` tag, but I’m hoping that we can get them to pass!
• apps, view-home-page
• members-crud
• collab
I agree we should have flexibility to work around the CI check once it’s blocking (ex: with the `SKIP_CI` tag, or by applying a `no-cypress` Github label, etc), but I hesitate to encourage using this before we’ve even made the CI check blocking
I've not used crafting before. I can try to set that up - do you have a guide I can follow?

you don’t need to set up your crafting dev environment to set up the data for the Cypress tests

you just need to go to https://crafting-aihub.test.instabase.com/ and set up the necessary apps like Doc Translation

(but if you’re curious about the crafting dev environment set up, you can follow this (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/2107736112/Setting+Up+Your+Crafting+Environment) and this (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/2107637801/Working+With+Crafting+Sandboxes))
